canonical.name: Ting
canonical.title: 50. Ting / The Cauldron
canonical.judgment: Ting gives the intimation of great progress and success.
canonical.image: The trigram representing wood, and above it that for fire, form Ting. The superior person, in accordance with this, keeps their every position correct, and maintains secure the appointment of Heaven.

1.text: shows the caldron overthrown and its feet turned up, but there will be advantage in its getting rid of what was in it. Or it shows us the concubine whose position is improved by means of her son. There will be no error.

2.text: shows the caldron with the things to be cooked in it. If its subject can say, 'My enemy dislikes me, but they cannot approach me', there will be good fortune.

3.text: shows the caldron with the places of its handles changed. The progress of its subject is thus stopped. The flesh of the pheasant which is in the caldron with not be eaten. But the genial rain will come, and the grounds for repentance will disappear. There will be good fortune in the end.

4.text: shows the caldron with its feet broken; and its contents, designed for the ruler's use, overturned and spilt. Its subject will be made to blush for shame. There will be evil.

5.text: shows the caldron with yellow ears and rings of metal in them. There will be advantage through being firm and correct.

6.text: shows the caldron with rings of jade. There will be great good fortune, and all action taken will be in every way advantageous.

metadata.notes: Original translation preserved from pyChing v1.2.2
